title: ORNIA
content:
ORNIA was the Naiad-nymph of the spring, well or fountain of the town of Orneai in Sikyonia (southern Greece).
        She was a daughter of the local river-god Asopos.

Diodorus Siculus, Library of History 4. 72. 1 (trans. Oldfather) (Greek historian
          C1st B.C.) :
        "Asopos (Asopus) made his home in Phlios (Phlius) [the region of Sikyon], where he married Metope, the
        daughter of Ladon, to whom were born two sons, Pelasgos and Ismenos, and twelve daughters, Korkyra (Corcyra) and
        Salamis, also Aigina (Aegina), Peirene, and Kleone (Cleone), then Thebe, Tanagra, Thespeia, and Asopis, also
        Sinope, and finally Ornia and Khalkis (Chalcis)."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
